metadata.title: CVE-2021-29650 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.11. The netfiltersubsystem allows attackers to cause a denial of service (panic) becausenet/netfilter/x_tables.c and include/linux/netfilter/x_tables.h lack a fullmemory barrier upon the assignment of a new table value, akaCID-175e476b8cdf.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-kvm - 4.4.0-1103.112
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-aws - 4.4.0-1138.152
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1102.109~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1099.112~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1071.79~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.112').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.152').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1102.109~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1114.127~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.112~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.79~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
